Articles.Content:
I had no clue what the Kerbal Space Program was. My husband had been going on and on about the deal on Steam so finally I bought it for him. I had only judged it by the funny looking characters, but when I realized it was a space flight simulator, I just haven't been able to stop playing it. I've had it three days, and have 30 hours into it.

I knew nothing about rocket building, so it took a while to figure that out.

My "accomplishments:"

Two successful Mun landings (I didn't know you could place a flag the first time and had to go back)

One successful Minmus landing

A satellite orbiting Earth

Two poor guys who are orbiting Kerbol in a huge orbit, farther out than any planet, who will never make it home because their rocket has no fuel.

I love the game, though. So I decided to sign up on these forums!
oh no!! you cant leave them!! i demand you send a rescue haha welcome to the community
Welcome! A Kerbol orbit rescue is definitely something to work up to.
